message: Thats really nice. Are you plaining to monetize it via affiliate or something?

Oh yeah I already have affiliate linking enabled. But here's the good part, I'll let anyone monetize TweetHit by redirecting visitors using their own affiliate IDs. Basically, a blogger can add his affiliate IDs as parameters (www.tweethit.com?us_id=<some-id>&uk_id=<some-other-id>), and the system will create item URLs using their data.
@znt, is that what you mentioned working yet?
aff-id-1 = affiliate id for amazon.com, aff-id-2 = affiliate id for amazon.co.uk, aff-id-3 = affiliate id for amazon.ca, aff-id-4 = affiliate id for amazon.de, aff-id-5 = affiliate id for amazon.fr
@psytek, yeah I just implemented basic affiliate affiliation (meta affiliate?). Here's sample url: http://www.tweethit.com/?us=aff-id-1&uk=aff-id-2&ca=aff-id-3&de=aff-id-4&fr=aff-id-5
There is any way that you could show the tweets that the people have tweeted about the products like tweetmeme do?
@sebastian1985, Nope not yet. Actually I don't even store the tweet data. I just ban spammer accounts to keep the noise down. Maybe I should work on it, any more suggestions?
No i just hope that you find the way to do something like that so the owners of the products could see that the numbers are real...
